pageContext.claim: “It was just a part of my speech. I'd say: ‘You're working three jobs. You make less money than you did 20 years ago.’ And it was literally 21 years. And now wages are going up.”
pageContext.analysis: During the 2016 campaign, Trump would repeatedly claim people had to work two ot three jobs to make ends meet or pay for Obamacare. But the percentage of workers holding two or more job has barely changed between 2016 and 2018; it has remained about five percent. Wages have not decreased in recent years. They have been rising steadily since 2014 but for many workers were stagnant in 2017, Trump's first year in office.
